metadata.description:
This data set includes observation data of meteorological elements in the Shenshawo Desert Station in the middle of the Heihe Hydrometeorological Observation Network from January 1, 2015 to April 12, 2015. The site is located in Shenshawo, Zhangye City, Gansu Province, and the underlying surface is desert. The latitude and longitude of the observation point is 100.4933E, 38.7892N, and the altitude is 1594m. The air temperature and relative humidity sensors are installed at 5m and 10m, facing the north; the barometer is installed at 2m; the tipping bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m; the wind speed sensor is set at 5m, 10m, and the wind direction sensor is set at 10m, facing the north; the four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing south; two infrared thermometers are installed at 6m, facing south, the probe orientation is vertically downward; the soil temperature probe is buried in the ground surface 0cm and underground 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm 40cm, 60cm and 100cm, in the south of the 2m from the meteorological tower; soil moisture sensors are buried in the underground 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm, in the south of the 2m from the meteorological tower, and among them a repetitive soil moisture sensor (Ms_40cm_2) was embedded in the underground 40cm on May 6, 2014.soil heat flux plates (3 pieces) are buried in the ground 6 cm in order.
Observation items include: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m, RH_5m, Ta_10m, RH_10m) (unit: centigrade, percentage), air pressure (Press) (unit: hectopascal), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_5m, WS_10m) (unit: m / s), wind direction (WD_10m) (unit: degree), four-component radiation (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts / square meter), surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2 ) (unit: centigrade), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts/square meter), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_60cm, Ms_100cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage) and soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_60cm, Ts_100cm) (unit: centigrade).
Processing and quality control of the observation data: (1) ensure 144 data per day (every 10 minutes), when there is missing data, it is marked by -6999; From March 19, 2015 to March 26, due to the collector problem, the data is missing; (2) eliminate the moment with duplicate records; (3) delete the data that is obviously beyond the physical meaning or the range of the instrument; (5) the format of date and time is uniform, and the date and time are in the same column. For example, the time is: 2015-6-10 10:30; (6) the naming rules are: AWS+ site name. The station was dismantled after April 12.
For hydrometeorological network or site information, please refer to Li et al. (2013). For observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).

该数据集包含了2015年1月1日至2015年4月12日黑河水文气象观测网中游神沙窝沙漠站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市神沙窝，下垫面是沙漠。观测点的经纬度是100.4933E, 38.7892N，海拔1594m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速传感器架设在5m、10m，风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方，其中40cm在2014.5.6埋设了1个重复的土壤水分传感器（Ms_40cm_2）；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm_1、Ms_40cm_2、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)和土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm）(单位：摄氏度)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；由于采集器问题，在2015.3.19-3.26之间部分数据缺失；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2015-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。4月12日后该站拆除。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡动协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量与观察到的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）比率进行了更好的验证。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，采用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值非常一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 在异质表面上生态水文过程的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的阻碍。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而解决这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次密集观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。针对绿洲-沙漠系统，仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置，以捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个双层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了密集观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区已被前期研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，涵盖了2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of how multiscale observations are used to study eco-hydrological processes in arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个例子，说明如何使用多尺度观测来研究干旱地区的生态水文过程？
Example.AnswerEn: The Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) employs a multiscale observation system that includes a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations, as well as remote sensing with LiDAR and imaging spectrometers to capture eco-hydrological processes in an oasis-desert area.
Example.AnswerCn: 黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）采用多尺度观测系统，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站的通量观测矩阵，以及利用激光雷达和成像光谱仪的遥感技术，以捕捉绿洲-沙漠地区的生态水文过程。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a method used to estimate evapotranspiration in an irrigated agricultural area?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否举一个在灌溉农业区域中用于估算蒸散发的方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model is used to estimate evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration in irrigated agricultural areas by utilizing ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, validated with stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes and eddy covariance measurements.
Example.AnswerCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型用于通过利用地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度来估算灌溉农业区域的蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散量，并通过稳定氧和氢同位素以及涡度协方差测量进行验证。

Definition.QuestionEn: How are 'soil and vegetation component temperatures' used in estimating evapotranspiration in eco-hydrological research?
Definition.QuestionCn: “土壤和植被组分温度”在生态水文研究中如何用于估算蒸散发？
Definition.AnswerEn: Soil and vegetation component temperatures are used as inputs in the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model to estimate evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration. These temperatures can be derived from high-resolution thermal cameras and are crucial for partitioning evapotranspiration into its soil and canopy components, as demonstrated in research involving the Daman superstation.
Definition.AnswerCn: 土壤和植被成分的温度作为输入用于双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型，以估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散。这些温度可以通过高分辨率热像仪获得，对于将蒸散分解为土壤和冠层成分至关重要，正如涉及达曼超级站的研究所示。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods in the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 dataset compare to those used in the HiWATER experiment in terms of instrumentation and data types collected?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验数据集中的数据收集方法与HiWATER实验在仪器和收集的数据类型方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The 黑河生态水文遥感试验 dataset employs ground-based meteorological instruments like sensors for air temperature, humidity, wind speed, and soil moisture to collect hydrometeorological data. In contrast, the HiWATER experiment utilizes a multiscale approach with eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and remote sensing instruments such as LiDAR and imaging spectrometers to capture eco-hydrological processes across multiple scales. Both focus on the detailed collection of physical environmental data but differ in scale and comprehensiveness of data types.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验数据集采用地面气象仪器，如空气温度、湿度、风速和土壤湿度传感器，收集水文气象数据。相比之下，HiWATER实验采用多尺度方法，使用涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪以及激光雷达和成像光谱仪等遥感仪器，捕捉多个尺度的生态水文过程。两者都专注于详细收集物理环境数据，但在数据类型的规模和全面性上有所不同。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the focus of datasets on hydrometeorological parameters differ from those concentrating on energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in the context of oasis–desert research?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠研究的背景下，专注于水文气象参数的数据集与集中于能量、水蒸气和碳通量的数据集之间的重点差异是什么？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Datasets focusing on hydrometeorological parameters, like those from the 神沙窝沙漠 station, typically emphasize detailed atmospheric and soil measurements, including temperature, humidity, and soil moisture at various depths. In contrast, datasets centered on energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, such as those in the HiWATER project, integrate broader ecological and atmospheric measurements, incorporating flux towers and remote sensing to study ecosystem interactions and carbon dynamics. The former is more localized and specific, while the latter offers a broader ecological perspective.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 关注水文气象参数的数据集，如神沙窝沙漠站的数据，通常强调详细的气象和土壤测量，包括不同深度的温度、湿度和土壤湿度。相比之下，集中于能量、水汽和碳通量的数据集，如HiWATER项目，整合了更广泛的生态和大气测量，结合通量塔和遥感技术研究生态系统相互作用和碳动态。前者更为局部和具体，而后者则提供了更广泛的生态视角。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What insights can be drawn from the hierarchical arrangement of data collection instruments about the interaction between oasis and desert systems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 从数据收集工具的层次安排中，可以得出关于绿洲与沙漠系统之间相互作用的见解。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The hierarchical arrangement of data collection instruments in hydrometeorological observations allows researchers to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes, providing insights into oasis-desert interactions. This approach facilitates the study of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, which are crucial for understanding the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 层次化的数据收集工具在水文气象观测中的安排，使研究人员能够捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程，从而深入了解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用。这种方法有助于研究能量、水汽和碳的交换，这对理解绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do the challenges of composite temperature separation in arid regions affect the reliability of evapotranspiration models, and what methodologies can enhance accuracy?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 干旱地区复合温度分离的挑战如何影响蒸散发模型的可靠性，以及哪些方法可以提高准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges in separating composite temperatures in arid regions impact the accuracy of evapotranspiration models, as errors in component temperature can propagate into model outputs. Enhanced methodologies, such as using high-resolution thermal cameras and detailed classification of soil and canopy pixels, can improve the precision of temperature measurements and, consequently, the reliability of evapotranspiration estimates.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，分离复合温度的挑战影响了蒸散发模型的准确性，因为成分温度的误差会传播到模型输出中。采用高分辨率热像仪和对土壤及树冠像素的详细分类等增强方法，可以提高温度测量的精确度，从而提高蒸散发估算的可靠性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways do multiscale observations contribute to understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems, and what are the potential implications for sustainable development?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测在理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换方面贡献巨大，其潜在的可持续发展影响包括：
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations offer a comprehensive view of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges within oasis-desert ecosystems, crucial for sustainable development. These observations help in recognizing interactions between oases and deserts, supporting ecological security and enabling strategies to maintain the balance necessary for sustainable oasis development.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测提供了对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的全面视角，这对可持续发展至关重要。这些观测有助于识别绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，支持生态安全，并促进维持可持续绿洲发展的平衡所需的策略。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in accurately estimating evapotranspiration using remote sensing data in heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，准确估计蒸散发的挑战因素包括哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: One significant factor is the complexity of the surface, which contains a mixture of soil and vegetation with different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. This heterogeneity makes it difficult for one-source models to estimate surface evapotranspiration accurately. Errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from remote sensing data, particularly due to image classification errors and atmospheric effects, also contribute to these challenges.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 一个重要因素是表面的复杂性，它包含了不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。这种异质性使得单一源模型难以准确估计表面蒸散发。通过遥感数据确定表面土壤和植被成分温度的错误，特别是由于图像分类错误和大气影响，也加剧了这些挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the limitation in the effectiveness of composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，复合温度分离方法有效性受限的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The limitation in the effectiveness of composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions is primarily due to errors in image classification, particularly when there is varying vegetation abundance. These classification errors can lead to misclassification of soil and vegetation pixels, resulting in overestimated canopy temperatures. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance can introduce uncertainties in estimated temperatures, further limiting the approach.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，复合温度分离方法的有效性受到限制，主要是由于图像分类中的错误，特别是在植被丰度变化时。这些分类错误可能导致土壤和植被像素的误分类，从而导致冠层温度的高估。此外，忽视大气向上辐射和透射率可能会引入温度估计的不确定性，进一步限制了该方法的有效性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of using hierarchically nested scales in data collection for understanding oasis-desert interactions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用层次嵌套尺度进行数据收集对理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using hierarchically nested scales in data collection allows for capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes, which helps in understanding oasis-desert interactions. This approach can provide comprehensive data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges across different landscapes, improving insights into these interactions and informing strategies for maintaining ecological stability and supporting sustainable development in oasis areas.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用分层嵌套尺度的数据收集方法可以捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程，有助于理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用。这种方法可以提供关于不同景观中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的全面数据，从而改善对这些相互作用的洞察，并为维持生态稳定和支持绿洲地区可持续发展提供信息。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the implementation of long-term observational datasets impact the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据集的实施如何影响对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的理解？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The implementation of long-term observational datasets enhances the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas by providing continuous and detailed data over extended periods. This facilitates the recognition of patterns, trends, and interactions in these systems, which are crucial for achieving goals related to ecological security, sustainable development, and carbon neutrality.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集的实施增强了对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的理解，因为它提供了持续和详细的长期数据。这有助于识别这些系统中的模式、趋势和相互作用，这对于实现生态安全、可持续发展和碳中和等目标至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of integrating remote sensing technologies with ground-based measurements in the collection of hydrometeorological data in oasis-desert areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将遥感技术与地面测量相结合，在绿洲-沙漠地区收集水文气象数据的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating remote sensing technologies with ground-based measurements can lead to a comprehensive dataset that covers both large-scale and localized eco-hydrological processes. This integration allows for the validation and refinement of models like the TSEB model, improving the accuracy of estimates for soil and vegetation component temperatures and enhancing the reliability of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration calculations.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将遥感技术与地面测量相结合，可以生成一个涵盖大规模和局部生态水文过程的综合数据集。这种整合可以验证和完善像TSEB模型这样的模型，提高土壤和植被成分温度估算的准确性，并增强蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发计算的可靠性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What goals drive the development of datasets containing long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon flux observations in oasis-desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 推动包含绿洲-沙漠系统中长期能源、水汽和碳通量观测数据集开发的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to provide a quantitative understanding of the interactions between oasis and desert systems, which is significant for recognizing their ecological stability, achieving carbon neutrality, and ensuring sustainable development in arid and semi-arid regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是定量理解绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用，这对于认识它们的生态稳定性、实现碳中和以及确保干旱和半干旱地区的可持续发展具有重要意义。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are instruments arranged and utilized to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert interactions, and what are the procedural steps for establishing such a network?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何安排和利用仪器捕捉绿洲-沙漠相互作用中的多尺度生态水文过程，以及建立这样一个网络的程序步骤是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Instruments are arranged on hierarchically nested scales to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes. The procedural steps include establishing a sparse network with superstations within oases, installing eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and using remote sensing technologies like LiDAR. Intensive observation periods are conducted to gather detailed data across different landscapes, including sandy deserts and wetlands.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行排列，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。程序步骤包括在绿洲内建立稀疏网络和超级站，安装涡度协方差塔、自动气象站，并使用激光雷达等遥感技术。进行密集观测期，以在不同景观（包括沙漠和湿地）中收集详细数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What instrumentation and observational strategies enable the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些仪器和观测策略能够在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集多尺度的生态水文数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The HiWATER experiment uses a hierarchical instrumentation strategy, including a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and an eco-hydrological sensor network. It also involves hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer, along with synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: HiWATER实验采用了分层仪器策略，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站和生态水文传感器网络的通量观测矩阵。它还涉及使用LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计进行超高分辨率的航空遥感，同时进行同步的地面测量以监测植被动态和光合作用过程。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection methods facilitate the long-term monitoring of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis-desert areas?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据收集方法可以促进对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的长期监测？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Long-term monitoring is facilitated by using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for turbulent flux data, automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data, and supplementary vegetation and soil parameters. Data is collected in half-hourly and 10-minute intervals and includes metrics such as radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 长期监测通过使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取湍流通量数据，自动气象站获取水文气象数据，以及补充的植被和土壤参数来实现。数据以半小时和10分钟的间隔收集，包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量和土壤湿度剖面等指标。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data collection in oasis–desert systems face challenges in maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems for sustainable development?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，数据收集可能面临挑战，以维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡，以实现可持续发展。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Data collection in oasis–desert systems may face challenges due to the need for a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange. This understanding is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and supporting ecological stability as well as socioeconomic development. Long-term observations are indispensable for achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality while maintaining ecological security and sustainable development.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，数据收集可能面临挑战，因为需要对能量、水蒸气和碳交换进行定量理解。这种理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用以及支持生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要。长期观察对于实现碳达峰和碳中和的目标，同时维护生态安全和可持续发展是不可或缺的。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the effectiveness of using remote sensing technologies, such as LiDAR and imaging spectrometers, for collecting data in heterogeneous eco-hydrological environments?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对在异质生态水文环境中使用遥感技术（如LiDAR和成像光谱仪）收集数据的有效性进行评估。
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Remote sensing technologies like LiDAR and imaging spectrometers are highly effective for collecting data in heterogeneous eco-hydrological environments. They allow for multiscale and multidisciplinary observations that are crucial for understanding complex processes. These technologies can capture detailed spatial and temporal variations, which are essential for addressing the challenges of upscaling eco-hydrological processes in diverse landscapes.

Judgmental.AnswerEn: Ensuring data quality control in large-scale observational networks is challenging due to the need for consistent sensor calibration, data collection, processing, and archiving across diverse environments and conditions. Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your perspective on the potential for improving soil and vegetation component temperature estimation in arid regions using high-resolution thermal cameras?

Judgmental.AnswerEn: High-resolution thermal cameras offer significant potential for improving the estimation of soil and vegetation component temperatures in arid regions. This capability is crucial for refining models like the TSEB model, which relies on precise temperature inputs to estimate evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration accurately. Despite challenges such as image classification errors, the use of high-resolution thermal data can enhance the reliability of temperature estimates and subsequently improve model predictions in these environments.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热像仪在改善干旱地区土壤和植被成分温度估计方面具有显著潜力。这些相机提供详细的热图像，可以用于准确分离和评估不同地表成分的温度。这一能力对于精细化像TSEB模型这样的模型至关重要，因为该模型依赖于精确的温度输入来准确估计蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发。尽管存在图像分类错误等挑战，但使用高分辨率热数据可以增强温度估计的可靠性，从而改善这些环境中的模型预测。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please propose potential datasets and data collection strategies to support long-term monitoring of energy and carbon exchanges in oasis-desert systems.

Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets for long-term monitoring should include energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, along with auxiliary data like hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters. Strategies should incorporate continuous observations from eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic weather stations. Integration of these datasets with hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing and synchronical ground measurements can provide a comprehensive understanding of oasis-desert interactions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的长期监测数据集应包括能量、水汽和碳通量，以及辅助数据如水文气象、植被和土壤参数。策略应包括来自涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站的连续观测。将这些数据集与超高分辨率的航空遥感和同步的地面测量相结合，可以提供对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的全面理解。
